channel.title: Latest Finextra Research Cards Headlines
channel.description: The Latest Financial IT Cards Headlines

item.title: Mastercard bids to kill passwords with new biometric service
item.description: Mastercard is hoping to consign passwords to the history books with a new biometric authentication service.

item.title: CFPB takes on non-sufficient fund fees
item.description: America's Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) has proposed a rule that would stop banks charging non-sufficient fund fees for transactions that are declined in real time.

item.title: Citi unveils browser extension to help shoppers find online offers
item.description: Citi has launched a free desktop browser extension that helps cardholders search for offers and coupons at thousands of online merchants.

item.title: Brex axes 20% of staff
item.description: Corporate spend management giant Brex has laid off 282 people (20% of its workforce) and revealed that its COO and CTO are leaving their roles.

item.title: Commerzbank and Global Payments form payments joint venture for SMEs
item.description: Global Payments and Commerzbank are to launch a joint venture company catering to the digital payment needs of small and medium sized enterprise in germany.

item.title: Swiss payments fintech Rivero raises $7 million
item.description: Swiss payment technology house Rivero has raised $7 million in Series A funding to step into new markets and boost its product development and workforce.

item.title: EBL to launch 'world-first' biometric metal card
item.description: Eastern Bank in Bangladesh is launching what it claims is the world's first biometric metal card for premium customers.

item.title: Visa expands Fintech Fast Track programme
item.description: Visa is expanding its North America Fintech Fast Track programme beyond card issuance to connect members to its real-time money movement platform.

item.title: Apple, Visa and Mastercard face anti-trust class action lawsuit
item.description: Apple, Visa and Mastercard are facing a class action lawsuit over allegations that they conspired to suppress competition in the market for point-of-sale payment card services.

item.title: UK payments watchdog proposes cap on interchange fees
item.description: The Payment Systems Regulator is propsing to cap cross-border interchange fees on credit and debit cards to protect UK businesses from rising costs.

item.title: JCB to begin Phase 2 trials of offline CBDC
item.description: Japanese card issuer JCB is moving to Phase 2 of a pilot to trial offline P2P payments for a central bank digital currency (CBDC).

item.title: Motive acquires controlling stake in Splitit Payments
item.description: Private equity firm Motive Partners has acquired a controlling stake in Australian-listed  BNPL outfit Splitit Payments.

item.title: FIFA extends Visa partnership
item.description: FIFA is delighted to announce the extension of its partnership with Visa (NYSE: V), a world leader in digital payments, as an official FIFA partner.

item.title: Torpago and Marqeta launch Sunwest Bank card programme
item.description: Torpago, a commercial credit card and spend management provider, Marqeta, strategic partner of Torpago and the global modern card issuing platform, and Sunwest Bank, a leading entrepreneurial business bank, announce the launch of Sunwest Visionary Card, Sunwest’s commercial credit card and expense management solution. Combining a cloud-native, event-driven infrastructure with Marqeta’s modern card issuing API, Torpago ‘Powered By’ empowers Sunwest to launch a market-leading, bank-branded credit card program.

item.title: ServiceNow builds disputes management system with Visa
item.description: ServiceNow (NYSE: NOW), the leading digital workflow company making the world work better for everyone, announced today a five-year strategic alliance with Visa, a world leader in digital payments, to transform payment services.

item.title: BlinkSky raises $1.5m
item.description: 2023 marked a significant milestone for BlinkSky, a global payments platform that delivers secure, interactive and customizable digital cards, real-time at scale.

item.title: Mastercard and The Clearing House extend real-time payments partnership
item.description: Mastercard and The Clearing House (TCH) have announced an extended multi-year partnership, bringing the companies together to collaborate on innovative capabilities for consumers, businesses and governments to evolve and embrace the digital economy through real-time payments (RTP) adoption on the RTP® network.

item.title: Ingenico builds smartPOS device on Cybersource fraud management platform
item.description: Ingenico, a global leader in payment acceptance and services, has announced a strategic partnership with Cybersource, Visa’s agnostic global payment and fraud management platform.

item.title: Fiserv's Polcard introduces PAX SmartPOS device into service suite
item.description: PolCard from Fiserv's strategic decision solidifies the position of PAX Android terminals, now embraced by all major payment terminal operators in Poland.

item.title: Fidesmo integrates to Mastercard’s Token Connect and partners with German neobank VIMpay
item.description: Fidesmo, a leader in providing secure and convenient contactless services, is proud to announce the successful completion of its integration between Fidesmo Pay and Mastercard’s Token Connect service, also known as MDES Token Connect.

item.title: Mastercard collaborates with ADGM for SME payment cards in the UAE
item.description: Mastercard and Abu Dhabi Global Market (ADGM) have announced a collaboration to fuel the growth of the booming small and medium enterprise (SME) sector in Abu Dhabi and the wider UAE by digitalizing SME payment flows.

item.title: TreviPay and Mastercard partner on B2B payments
item.description: TreviPay, the most-trusted B2B payments and invoicing network, today announced the launch of its Universal Acceptance solution to expand supplier access to and faster implementation of TreviPay’s payments and invoicing technology, in partnership with Mastercard.

item.title: Accept Cards becomes employee owned
item.description: Leading payments broker Accept Cards - which works with more than 260 accountancy and financial services firms in the UK - has become employee owned, with all the shares transferring to an Employee Ownership Trust (EOT).

item.title: Mastercard scales use of virtual cards for healthcare claims
item.description: Fragmented, slow and inefficient payment processes have long been a challenge within the healthcare ecosystem.

item.title: Changing the future of credit with agile engineering
item.description: In this episode of Unplugged, Harry Jell, CTO at Yonder, talks with Andrew Smith from RTGS.global, about building a successful credit card company in today’s financial climate. They discuss the seamless use of merchant data for user rewards, the importance of AWS and Kubernetes for scalability, and explore potential avenues to enrich transaction data.

item.title: Payments in a hyper-personalized world
item.description: Randy Kern, Chief Technology Officer, Marqeta joins FinextraTV at Money20/20 in Las Vegas, discussing how the expectations of customers are shifting in a hyper-personalized world, what innovations are being made in APIs, and how the nature of card payments are changing to meet the demands for quick, efficient and seamless payments.

item.title: Fiat Currency 2.0: Counter argument to the Cryptocurrency narrative
item.description: Tony McLaughlin, Emerging Payments & Business Development, Citi, speaks at Money 20/20 USA about the practical problems that still need addressing in the crypto-currency community, how Fiat Currency 2.0 will help fix payments as a counter balance to crypto and what challenges still exist around tokenisation and coins. We ask how this impacts the big techs and what regulatory, political and ethical concerns need to be addressed first before they achieve their own currencies.

item.title: Developer Day at FusionONE stirs excitement among the users
item.description: Finextra’s Hannah Wallace reports on day two of the FusionONE open banking developer conference to learn more about Finastra’s vision for the future of banking re-engineered upon APIs and open platforms. We gain exclusive insight from the developers into what's exciting them most about FusionFabric.cloud and how they are looking to innovate and create using the platform.

item.title: Encapsulating themes from the payments market
item.description: Marion King, Director of Payments, NatWest, speaks about her role and the responsibility it entails, including determining payments strategy for a major UK Bank, keeping NatWest's customers secure, regulation and innovation, what key themes we are seeing in the payments market and the developments to come.

item.title: Exploring new commerce: Mastercard's Sonic Signature
item.description: Raja Rajamannar, Chief Marketing & Communications Officer and President, Healthcare Business, Mastercard, speaks at Mobile World Congress about the unveiling of Mastercard's Sonic Brand, the thinking behind the new musical logo and how it was developed.

item.title: The Power of Partnerships: Trust, Data & Digital Identity
item.description: Ann Cairns, Vice Chair, Mastercard, speaks at Mobile World Congress 2019 about the importance of partnerships, Mastercard's partnership with Microsoft, how they are using data in medicine and towards social reform, and what impact neobanks are having on the industry.

item.title: Industry challenges around IBOR Transition
item.description: Andrew Kouloumbrides, CEO, Xceptor and Bruce Laing, Partner, IBOR Transition lead, Baringa, speaks about the industry challenges around IBOR Transition, what Financial Institutions have done up to date to meet these challenges and what to expect next.

item.title: The global adoption of real-time payments, sparking industry innovation
item.description: Paul Stoddart, Chief Executive Officer, Vocalink & Colleen Taylor, Executive Vice President, Mastercard, speak at Sibos 2018 in Sydney about recent innovations having an impact on the consumer, which markets are ahead of the curve when it comes to adopting the latest real-time applications and how some of the latest innovations have tackled the issue of security, when leveraging the real-time rails.

item.title: When, if ever, will the Nordics become cashless?
item.description: Erik Zingmark, Head of Transaction Banking, Nordea, speaks at Sibos 2018 in Sydney, whether banks are really being disrupted by fintechs, what corporates are expecting from their banks in the next 3 to 5 years, and when, if ever, it will become cashless in the Nordics.

item.title: Bringing together the vision of connected commerce
item.description: Gerrard Schmid, President and Chief Executive Officer Diebold Nixdorf, speaks at Diebold Nixdorf's International Management Seminar in Lisbon, about how banks need to support their customers through multi-channels as a result of digitisation, what is driving mobile banking, where the potential is for retail banks, and whether cash is really becoming extinct.

item.title: The combined effect of Open Banking and Real-time Payments
item.description: Jerry Norton, Vice President and Global Head of Banking for CGI, talks about how the combined effect of Open Banking and real-time payments on banks and what they need to do to adapt to the changing landscape.

item.title: Digitalizing CLM for improved customer experience
item.description: Joe Dunphy, VP of Product Management, Fenergo, discusses what benefits digitalising the client lifecycle experience can bring financial institutions and their clients, how Fenergo’s CLM roadmap has evolved over the past two years to deliver greater transparency and control, and the importance of Fenergo’s global client community for driving industry best practice.
